A001.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Certificate of authenticity for fresh 'EMPEROR' table grapes.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
A001.guidance_chief: - Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>.

- A separate C085 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each individual CHED-PP.

- Note

- When declaring document code C085, previous document code DCR must be declared in DE 2/1 at header level with the trader's reference number which enables the transaction to be traced in the trader's records.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>
C085.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C089.guidance_cds:
- Enter the export authorisation reference number.

- If more than one export authorisation covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>
C089.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C100.guidance_cds:
- Enter the Registered Exporter Number.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='To be used when declaration of a REX number is required'>RE</abbr>
C100.guidance_chief: - Document status code will be <abbr title='To be used when declaration of a REX number is required'>RE</abbr>.

C119.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Authorised Release Certificate, formerly referred to as Certificate of airworthiness or equivalent certificate.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Faxed copy not acceptable

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>
C119.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C400.guidance_cds:
- In the document ID field, state the document code (C401, C402, C403, C404, C405, C406, C635, C638 or C639) for the CITES document being used.

- One of these document codes must always be declared in addition to C400.

- The identification of the CITES document should be declared against the additional CITES document code rather than against C400.

- All CITES documentation requring endorsement must be presented at the frontier.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C400.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C401.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES export permit or re-export certificate issued by an EU-country.

- If using more than one permit, then a separate C401 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each permit.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C401

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C401.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C402.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES export permit or re-export certificate issued by a third country.

- If using more than one permit, then a separate C402 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each permit.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C402

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C402.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C403.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES travelling exhibition certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C403 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C403

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C403.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C404.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES personal ownership certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C404 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C404

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C404.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C405.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES sample collection certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C405 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C405

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C405.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C406.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the CITES musical instrument Certificate.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate C406 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C406

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C406.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C501.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplifications - authorisation in the format:

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplification - authorisation is held, i.e. AEOC 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C501.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C502.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Authorised Economic Operator - Security and Safety - authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an Authorised Economic Operator - Security and Safety - is held, i.e. AEOS 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C502.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C503.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplification/Security and Safety - authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an Authorised Economic Operator - Customs Simplification/Security and Safety - is held, i.e. AEOF 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C503.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C504.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the authorisation for the simplification of the determination of amounts being part of the customs value of goods in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorisation for the simplification of the determination of amounts being part of the customs value of goods is held, i.e. CVA 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C504.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C505.guidance_cds:
Enter: 


GBCGUguaranteenotrequired 

For deferment accounts: 


Enter status code CC 

For OGDs and Public Bodies: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr>

For fixed energy installations: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr> 

For goods exempted under TA (article 81, regulation No. (EU) 2015/2446: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr> 

For goods below the statistical threshold: 


Enter status code <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below de minimis'>XB</abbr>

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): CC, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below de minimis'>XB</abbr>, <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr>
C505.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C506.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the deferment of payment authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a deferment of payment authorisation is held, i.e. DPO 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C506.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C507.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the repayment decision.

- Or Enter the reference number assigned by the exporter to the application for the rejected import claim.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below de minimis'>XB</abbr>
C507.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C508.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the remission decision.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below de minimis'>XB</abbr>
C508.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C509.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the operation of temporary storage facilities authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an operation of temporary storage facilities authorisation is held, i.e. TST 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C509.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C510.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the regular shipping services authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a regular shipping services authorisation is held, i.e. RSS 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C510.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C511.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the status of authorised issuer authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C511.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C512.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the simplified declaration authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a simplified declaration authorisation is held, i.e. SDE 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C512.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C513.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the centralised clearance in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a centralised clearance authorisation is held, i.e. CCL 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C513.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C514.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for EIDR in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an EIDR authorisation is held, i.e. EIR 

- Followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C514.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C515.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation number for self-assessment in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a self-assessment authorisation is held, i.e. SAS 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C515.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C516.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation number for temporary admission in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3/4 digit code indicating that a temporary admission authorisation) is held, i.e. TEA/TEAH 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C516.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C517.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the private customs warehouse in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating the type of warehouse, i.e. CWP

- alpha numeric code issued by the authorising member state for the warehouse.

- In the UK this will be the warehouse ID No. as declared in DE 2/7 (ex-box 49 on a SAD/ C88) 

- Note: if goods are being transferred from one private customs warehouse to another private customs warehouse, enter the code for the receiving warehouse.

- The dispatching warehouse is entered as a PREMS statement in DE 2/2 - Please see the Procedure Code notes and Appendix 4 for further details.

- No document status code is required.
C517.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C518.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the customs warehouse in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating the type of warehouse, i.e. CW1

- alpha numeric code issued by the authorising member state for the warehouse.

- In the UK this will be the warehouse ID No. as declared in DE 2/7 (ex-box 49 on a SAD/ C88).

- No document status code is required.
C518.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C519.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the customs warehouse in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating the type of warehouse, i.e. CW2

- alpha numeric code issued by the authorising member state for the warehouse.

- In the UK this will be the warehouse ID No. as declared in DE 2/7 (ex-box 49 on a SAD/ C88)

- No document status code is required.
C519.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C520.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation number for the ACT status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorised consignee for TIR procedure authorisation is held, i.e. ACT

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C520.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C521.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the ACR status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorised consignor for Union transit authorisation is held, i.e. ACR

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C521.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C522.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the ACE status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorised consignee for Union transit authorisation is held, i.e. ACE

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C522.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C523.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the SSE status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorisation for the use of seals of a special type is held, i.e. SSE 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C523.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C524.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the TRD status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorisation to use a transit declaration with a reduced data set is held, i.e. TRD 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C524.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C525.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the ETD status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an authorisation for the use of an electronic transport document as a customs declaration is held, i.e. ETD 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C525.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C526.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the AWB status in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that a weigher of bananas authorisation is held, i.e. AWB 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C526.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C600.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Free Zone in the following format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 2 digit code indicating that a Free Zone authorisation is held, i.e. FZ 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C600.guidance_chief:
- Reference: Enter either :

- details of guarantee (if applicable); or

- if goods are being transferred from one warehouse/free zone to another, enter the code for the dispatching warehouse/free zone.

- Note: No status code (as contained in document status codes for harmonised declarations) is required.

C601.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the Inward processing authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an inward processing authorisation is held, i.e. IPO 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C601.guidance_chief:
- Reference: <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr> authorisation reference as defined under Box 44 CUSTOMS SCHEMES.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Note: No status code (as contained in document status codes for harmonised declarations) is required.

C602.guidance_cds:
- Enter 'DV1 cont.

- sheet completed'

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C602.guidance_chief:
- There is no formal reference for a C105A.

- Declarant has the option to enter a reference.

C605.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the INF3.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of INF3s cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the INF3s concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where INF3s are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each INF3 concerned.

- Faxed copy not acceptable

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C605.guidance_chief:
- Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> if certification is required otherwise use status code <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

C612.guidance_cds:
- The Movement Reference Number (<abbr title='Movement Reference Number'>MRN</abbr>) for the Union transit movement.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>

C635.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by: 

- For imports: ICP and the label number.

- For exports: ECP and the label number.

- If using more than one label, then a separate C635 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each label.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C635

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
C635.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>.

C638.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by: 

- For imports: ICP and the permit number.

- For exports: ECP and the permit number.

- If using more than one permit, then a separate C638 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each licence.

- C400 must always be declared in addition to C638

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>

C640.guidance_cds:
To import live animal commodities subject to the 'Veterinary control' measure, with document code C640, you must:

1. Prenotify your import in advance in IPAFFS. IPAFFS produces a unique reference for your prenotification in the format of either IMP.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn or CHEDA.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., CHEDA.GB.2022.2468435)

2. Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

    - Document Code is C640

    - Document Identifier – format of GBCHDyyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., GBCHD2022.2468435)

    - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AE, JA, JE, LE or LP
C640.guidance_chief: - <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>

C641.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by TFC and the catch document number.

- If using more than one catch document, then a separate C641 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each catch document.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>

C669.guidance_cds:

C673.guidance_cds:
To import fish commodities subject to the 'Control on illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing for All countries' measure with document code C673, you must: 

1. Prenotify details of your C673 IUU catch certificate within your N853 CHEDP IPAFFS prenotification

2. Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

    - Document Code is C673

    - Document Identifier – GBIUU

    - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AE, AG, IE, IP
C673.guidance_chief:
- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr> or <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>.

- See also code Y927 which is to be declared for exempt fish and fish products.

C676.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the xxx (e.g. type of authorisation) authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3/4 digit code indicating that a national authorisation is held 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C676.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C678.guidance_cds:
To import high risk food not of animal origin commodities subject to the 'Entry into free circulation (restriction - feed and food) measure', with document code C678, you must:

1. Prenotify your import in advance in IPAFFS. IPAFFS produces a unique reference for your prenotification of the format of either IMP.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn or CHEDD.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., CHEDD.GB.2022.2468435)

2. Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

    - Document Code is C678

    - Document Identifier – format of GBCHDyyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., GBCHD2022.2468435)

    - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AE, JA, JE, LE, or LP
C678.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C700.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the INF4.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of INF4s cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the INF4s concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where INF4s are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each INF4 concerned.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C700.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C710.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the INF.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of INFs cover the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the INFs concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where INFs are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each INF concerned.

- For Paper INF form: Use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr> if certification is required otherwise use status code <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>.

- If an electronic INF submitted on the EU central trader portal, use status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>
C710.guidance_chief: - If you have an electronic INF submitted on the EU Central Trader Portal, enter document code C710 and status code <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, as well as the INF reference number

C715.guidance_cds:
- Provide the IOSS VAT Identification number issued for use under the Special Scheme in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of issue, e.g. GB 

- 4 digit code indicating that an IOSS is held: IOST: IOSS VAT Identification Number issued to a Taxable Person IOSI: IOSS VAT Identification Number issued to an Intermediary 

- followed by the IOSS VAT Identification Number.

- No document status code is required.
C715.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

C990.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the end use authorisation ships and platforms in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an end use authorisation ships and platforms is held, i.e. EUS (Authorisation code) 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
C990.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - surrendered'>IS</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>
L100.guidance_chief:
- Enter one of the following 3-digit licence identifiers as shown below:

- LIC, LIP, LPD, LPR, ESU, EIP, EHS, EPS, EPD.

- Followed by the unique licence number.

- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - surrendered'>IS</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>.

L116.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by KIM and the certificate number.

- If using more than one certificate, then a separate L116 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each certificate.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>
L116.guidance_chief: - Only status codes <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr> is permitted (see document status codes for harmonised declarations for definitions).

L135.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the authorisation document.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of documents covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the documents concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where documents are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each document concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>
L135.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

L136.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

L139.guidance_cds:
- Enter GBSAN followed by the reference number of the licence.

- If using more than one licence, then a separate L139 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each licence.

- As a temporary measure for CDS, a print of the electronic licence must be uploaded for manual validation and decrementing.

- Once CDS electronic licence functionality is updated for L139, the status codes will be amended to the E series appropriate to electronic licences.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
L139.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

L142.guidance_cds:
- Enter GBSAN followed by the reference number of the licence.

- If using more than one licence, then a separate L142 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each licence.

- As a temporary measure for CDS, a print of the electronic licence must be uploaded for manual validation and decrementing.

- Once CDS electronic licence functionality is updated for L142, the status codes will be amended to the E series appropriate to electronic licences.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
L142.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

N002.guidance_cds:
To import commodities subject to the 'HMI Conformity Certificate (fruit and veg) measure', with document code N002, you must prenotify your import in advance in IPAFFS or PEACH.

1. If you prenotify in IPAFFS:
    - IPAFFS produces a unique reference for your prenotification of the format of CHEDPP.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., CHEDPP.GB.2022.2468435)

    - Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

        - Document Code is N002

        - Document Identifier – format of GBCHDyyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., GBCHD2022.2468435)

        - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AE, JA, JE, LE, LP 

2. If you prenotify in PEACH:

    - The DUCR that you enter onto your PEACH prenotification must be the same as the DUCR on your CDS or CHIEF customs declaration.

    - Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

        - Document Code is N002

        - Document Identifier – GBCON

        - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AG, AP, AS, JA, JE, JS
N002.guidance_chief:
- Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr>, <abbr title='Electronic or paper document to be advised'>XA</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>.

- For CHED-PP: 

- GBCVD followed by CHED-PP reference number.

N851.guidance_cds:
To import commodities subject to the 'Phytosanitary certificate (import)' measure, with document code N851, you must prenotify your import in advance in IPAFFS or PEACH.

1. If you prenotify in IPAFFS:

    - IPAFFS produces a unique reference for your prenotification of the format of CHEDPP.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., CHEDPP.GB.2022.2468435)

    - Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

      - Document Code is N851

      - Document Identifier – format of GBCHDyyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., GBCHD2022.2468435)

      - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AE, JA, JE, LE, LP

2. If you prenotify in PEACH:

   - The DUCR that you enter onto your PEACH prenotification must be the same as the DUCR on your CDS customs declaration.

   - Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

     - Document Code is N851

     - Document Identifier – GBPHC

     - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AG, AP, AS, JA, JE, JS
N851.guidance_chief: - Use one of the [status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Electronic details on CHIEF - exhausted'>EE</abbr>, <abbr title='Electronic details on CHIEF - surrendered'>ES</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>IE</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - surrendered'>IS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - surrendered'>JS</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>.

N852.guidance_cds:
- Enter the country code for the country of issue (GB for the UK) followed by CED and the reference number of the CED.

- If using more than one CED, then a separate N852 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each CED.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Waiver claimed'>XW</abbr>, <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>
N852.guidance_chief: - <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>

N853.guidance_cds:
To import product of animal origin commodities subject to the 'veterinary control' measure with document code N853, you must:

1.  Prenotify your import in advance in IPAFFS. IPAFFS produces a unique reference for your prenotification of the format of either IMP.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn or CHEDP.GB.yyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., CHEDP.GB.2022.2468435)

2.  Input information into your customs declaration into DE 2/3 (CDS):

    - Document Code is N853

    - Document Identifier – format of GBCHDyyyy.nnnnnnn (e.g., GBCHD2022.2468435)

    - Status Code - Use one of the following document status codes: AE, JA, JE, LE, or LP
N853.guidance_chief: - Use [status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations) <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr> or <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr> as appropriate.

N990.guidance_cds:
- Provide the authorisation decision number for the end use authorisation in the format: 

- 2 digit code identifying the member state of authorisation, e.g. GB 

- 3-digit code indicating that an end use authorisation is held, i.e. EUS (Authorisation code) 

- followed by the authorisation reference number.

- No document status code is required.
N990.guidance_chief:
- Reference: Scheme authorisation reference as defined under Box 44 customs schemes.

- Faxed copy not acceptable.

- Note: No status code (as contained in document status codes for harmonised declarations) is required.

X839.guidance_cds:
- Enter GBSAN followed by the reference number of the licence.

- If using more than one licence, then a separate X839 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each licence.

- As a temporary measure for CDS, a print of the electronic licence must be uploaded for manual validation and decrementing.

- Once CDS electronic licence functionality is updated for X839, the status codes will be amended to the E series appropriate to electronic licences.

- Use the following [document status code](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>
X839.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y001.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the Certificate.

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document retained)'>AG</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the trader)'>AS</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>JE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>UE</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is unavailable - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>UP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - surrendered'>US</abbr>, <abbr title='Document not required - quantity below de minimis'>XB</abbr>

Y082.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement: 'Exempt from regulation 2017/1509' Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are eligible for an exemption under Article 16e (1) of Regulation 2017/1509.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.

Y100.guidance_cds:
- Enter the reference number of the licence.

- If using more than one licence, then a separate Y100 entry in DE 2/3 is required for each licence.

- Note

- When declaring document code Y100, previous document code DCR must be declared in DE 2/1 at header level with the trader's reference number which enables the transaction to be traced in the trader's records.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - Y105.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Exempt from <abbr title='Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals'>REACH</abbr>' in the Document Reason (Fourth Component).

- The Document Identity (Second Component) must be left blank.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods do not require a <abbr title='Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals'>REACH</abbr> authorisation.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y105.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y107.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement: 'Exempt - aircraft spare parts' Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are aircraft spare parts and are eligible for an exemption under the CD footnote.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y107.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y108.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement: 'Exempt sports calibre.22' Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are sport equipment of calibre.22 inches and are eligible for an exemption from the prohibition.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y108.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y109.guidance_cds:

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods do not require a <abbr title='Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals'>REACH</abbr> authorisation.

- No document status code is required.

Y115.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Exempt from <abbr title='Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals'>REACH</abbr>'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods do not require a <abbr title='Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals'>REACH</abbr> authorisation.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand

- No document status code is required.
Y115.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y116.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Exempt A.254, Regulation 952/2013' Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are exempt from the provisions of Article 254 of Regulation (EU) No 952/2013.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption which must be produced on demand

- No document status code is required.
Y116.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y117.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Free circulation not authorised'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are considered to be a dangerous product prohibited from release to free circulation under Regulation (EU) 2019/1020, Art.

- 28(1) of 20 June 2019 on market surveillance and compliance of products and amending Directive 2004/42/EC and Regulations (EC) No 765/2008 and (EU) No 305/2011.

- Goods using this document code must not be declared to a free circualtion procedure code.

- No document status code is required.
Y117.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y118.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Free circulation not authorised'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are considered to be not in conformity and prohibited from release to free circulation under Regulation (EU) 2019/1020, Art.

- 28(2) of 20 June 2019 on market surveillance and compliance of products and amending Directive 2004/42/EC and Regulations (EC) No 765/2008 and (EU) No 305/2011.

- Goods using this document code must not be declared to a free circualtion procedure code.

- No document status code is required.
Y118.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y120.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Excluded from regulation 517/2014'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are exempted from the reduction of the quantity of hydrofluorocarbons placed on the EU market according to article 15.2 first sub paragraph of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption, which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y120.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y123.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 517/2014 Registered'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are covered by an undertaking registered according to Art.

- 19 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014, and Article 1.2 of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 1191/2014 as amended by Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/1375.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate compliance with the registration obligations, which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y123.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y124.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Excluded from regulation 517/2014'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are entitled to an exemption from the registration requirement according to Art.

- 19.1 and 19.4 of Regulation (EU) No 517/2014, and Article 1.2 of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 1191/2014 as amended by Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/1375.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption, which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y124.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y125.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 517/2014 Quota'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are imported under a quota allocated pursuant to Regulation (EU) No 517/2014 Article 16(5) or transferred pursuant to Article 18.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate compliance with quota controls, which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y125.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y127.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Not from Turkey'.

- Use of this document code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods do not originate in, nor were they dispatched from, Turkey.

Y927.guidance_chief:
- Use status code <abbr title='Ex-heading goods for which the document does not apply'>XX</abbr>.

- This document code is to be used for fish/fish products which are listed in Annex 1 of Regulation 1005/2008 as not requiring a catch certificate.

- Note: document code Y927 is not required for those fish/fish products falling within commodity codes that are completely excluded from the scope of the Regulations.

- Example: eels caught in marine waters declare code C673; eels caught in fresh water declare code Y927; eels from acquaculture, obtained from fry or larvae declare code Y927.

- Freshwater crayfish, however, are not subject to IUU control and therefore no document code should be declared.

- (These examples were correct at time of printing and are intended to assist in deciding which document code is declared or if one is necesssary.

- This advice is not definitive and you should check current regulations in The Official Journal of the EU or with lead department Defra).

- Where a sequentially numbered range of certificates covers the goods, enter the lowest to the highest reference numbers of the certificates concerned, e.g. document code + 0054037-0054047: status code.

- Where certificates are not sequentially numbered, enter the reference number of each certificate concerned.

- Use one of the following [document status codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations/uk-trade-tariff-document-status-codes-for-harmonised-declarations): <abbr title='Document attached for certification by customs'>AC</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the trader)'>AE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry (document returned to the relevant Department)'>AF</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - part use (applies to this and other entries) (document returned to the trader)'>AP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document attached - surrendered (document returned to the relevant department)'>AT</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>GE</abbr>, <abbr title='Document with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>GP</abbr>, <abbr title='Facsimile with the goods - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>HP</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - already attributed on simplified declaration'>IA</abbr>, <abbr title='Details held by issuing authority - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>IP</abbr>, <abbr title='Document held by authorised trader - already attributed on simplified declaration'>JA</abbr>, <abbr title='Evidence required is available from trader - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>JP</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - exhausted by (or only applies to) this entry'>LE</abbr>, <abbr title='Lodged previously - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>LP</abbr>, <abbr title='Special authorisation for attached facsimile (paper held by trader) - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>SP</abbr>, <abbr title='Special authorisation for facsimile with the goods (paper held by trader) - part use (applies to this and other entries)'>TP</abbr>, <abbr title='Paper (held by trader) unavailable - already attributed on simplified declaration'>UA</abbr>
Y992.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y993.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 833/2014 exempt'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are entitled to an exemption from the prohibition defined in Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y993.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y994.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 833/2014 exempt'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are entitled to an exemption from the prohibition defined in Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y994.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y995.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 833/2014 exempt'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are not concerned by Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014 Articles 2.1 and 2a.1 prohibiting the export of dual use goods and technology to Russia.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y995.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y996.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'regulation 833/2014 exempt'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are not concerned with the prohibition contained in Council Regulation (EU) No 833/2014.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y996.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y997.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement -

- For imports 'Not from Crimea or Sevastopol' 

- Use of this code on import constitutes a legal declaration that the goods do not originate in Crimea or Sevastopol and are therefore not subject to prohibition under Article 2(a) Council Regulation (EU) No 692/2014 as amended

- For exports 'Export not to Crimea or Sevastopol'

- Use of this code on export constitutes a legal declaration that the goods are not being exported to Crimea or Sevastopol and are therefore not subject to the prohibition under Article 2b(1) Council Regulation (EU) No 692/2014 as amended

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y997.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y998.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'Not for use in Crimea or Sevastopol'

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that there are no reasonable grounds to determine that the goods are to be used in Crimea or Sevastopol and are therefore entitled to benefit from the exemption under Article 2b(3) Council Regulation (EU) No 692/2014 as amended

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this exemption which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y998.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.

Y999.guidance_cds:
- Complete the statement 'CDS Waiver'.

- Use of this code constitutes a legal declaration that the goods do not require the certificate or licence shown.

- Sufficient evidence must be held in records to demonstrate eligibility for this waiver which must be produced on demand.

- No document status code is required.
Y999.guidance_chief: This document code is available on CDS only.
